activities: Fossil utilizes information from its customers to help it improve its customers’ shopping experience and to communicate information about its products, services, promotions, and contests. In addition, Fossil receives, processes and uses personal information in various forms relating to current, former and prospective employees of its EU based affiliates to carry out its obligations under employment and benefit laws, to administer employee participation in its benefit, compensation and human resources plans and programs, for performance management, for compliance and discipline reporting and investigation, and to carry out and support the corporation's human resources functions and activities.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Netherlands, Norway, Portugal, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
recoursemech: The Direct Marketing Association’s (DMA) Safe Harbor complaint resolution process will be used for consumer privacy complaints. The EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) will be used for employee privacy complaints that can not be resolved internally.
